intro: Thibaudia cardenasii, commonly known as the golden star hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-centered flowers with white petals. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy appearance. Thibaudia cardenasii thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
